CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12,13 The highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of this so - called donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units , respectively , thus the band gap can be well tuned by the choice of D and A. Such a D-A strategy is now widely used as one of the most promising approaches to design efficient polymers for application to the polymer photovoltaic. Thiophene is a simple and fundamental block to construct new D-A type copolymers. Recently , the bridged dithiophene has attracted considerable attention as a donor unit because of its ability to fix the dithiophene system into a planar structure , which is much more efficient than the dithiophene in constructing highly - conjugated copolymers. Four bridging dithiophene units with the atoms of carbon ( C ) , silicon ( Si ) , germanium ( Ge ) and nitrogen ( N ) afford cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene ( CPDT ) , dithienosilole ( DTS ) , dithienogermole ( DTG ) and dithieno [ 3,2- b : 2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , respectively. CPDT was first introduced into the low band gap polymers , and the corresponding copolymer alternating CPDT with benzothiadiazole showed a PCE of 5.5% , after using a small amount of alkanedithiols to control the morphology of the blend film. 14,15 Later on , large amounts of CPDT - based photovoltaic polymers were designed and synthesized. [16][17][18][19][20] In comparison with the C-C bond , a longer C-Si bond shows less steric hindrance , which directly resulted in better π-π stacking along the conjugated polymer backbones. 21,22 Polymers based on DTS normally have high hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum and hence the improvement in photovoltaic performance , which reached 5.1% . 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor. [23][24][25] Planar dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , with good π-conjugation , showed great potential for use in organic electronic materials. 26 D-A type photovoltaic polymers with DTP as the electron - donating unit , exhibiting low band gap and enhanced solubility , have been intensively applied to PSCs. 27,28 In our previous study , PSCs based on DTP - containing copolymers and PC 70 BM showed a short - circuit current as high as 22.6 mA cm^-1 , 29 indicating that DTP - containing copolymers could be promising building blocks for superior photovoltaic performance. On the other hand , benzothiadiazole ( BT ) containing the electron - withdrawing imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen has been widely used as a strong acceptor in D-A copolymers. 30,31 Numerous attempts to develop novel D-A copolymers have shown that 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DTBT ) is an effective acceptor unit , and photovoltaic devices made from blends with fullerene derivatives show PCE up to 5.4% .

Let's think step by step.

The "Material Name" entities in the paragraph can be identified as follows:

1. CPDT (cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene)
2. DTS (dithienosilole)
3. DTG (dithienogermole)
4. DTP (dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole)
5. BT (benzothiadiazole)
6. DTBT (4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole)

These are the names of specific materials that are mentioned in the paragraph as being used in the design and synthesis of donor-acceptor copolymers for photovoltaic applications.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Material Name in the given paragraph:

1. CPDT
2. DTS
3. DTG
4. DTP
5. DTBT

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities in the "Material Name" column:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| CPDT |
| DTS |
| DTG |
| DTP |
| DTBT |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12,13 The highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of this so - called donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units , respectively , thus the band gap can be well tuned by the choice of D and A. Such a D-A strategy is now widely used as one of the most promising approaches to design efficient polymers for application to the polymer photovoltaic. Thiophene is a simple and fundamental block to construct new D-A type copolymers. Recently , the bridged dithiophene has attracted considerable attention as a donor unit because of its ability to fix the dithiophene system into a planar structure , which is much more efficient than the dithiophene in constructing highly - conjugated copolymers. Four bridging dithiophene units with the atoms of carbon ( C ) , silicon ( Si ) , germanium ( Ge ) and nitrogen ( N ) afford cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene ( CPDT ) , dithienosilole ( DTS ) , dithienogermole ( DTG ) and dithieno [ 3,2- b : 2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , respectively. CPDT was first introduced into the low band gap polymers , and the corresponding copolymer alternating CPDT with benzothiadiazole showed a PCE of 5.5% , after using a small amount of alkanedithiols to control the morphology of the blend film. 14,15 Later on , large amounts of CPDT - based photovoltaic polymers were designed and synthesized. [16][17][18][19][20] In comparison with the C-C bond , a longer C-Si bond shows less steric hindrance , which directly resulted in better π-π stacking along the conjugated polymer backbones. 21,22 Polymers based on DTS normally have high hole mobility and strong light absorption in the visible region of the solar spectrum and hence the improvement in photovoltaic performance , which reached 5.1% . 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor. [23][24][25] Planar dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole ( DTP ) , with good π-conjugation , showed great potential for use in organic electronic materials. 26 D-A type photovoltaic polymers with DTP as the electron - donating unit , exhibiting low band gap and enhanced solubility , have been intensively applied to PSCs. 27,28 In our previous study , PSCs based on DTP - containing copolymers and PC 70 BM showed a short - circuit current as high as 22.6 mA cm^-1 , 29 indicating that DTP - containing copolymers could be promising building blocks for superior photovoltaic performance. On the other hand , benzothiadiazole ( BT ) containing the electron - withdrawing imine ( -CvN- ) nitrogen has been widely used as a strong acceptor in D-A copolymers. 30,31 Numerous attempts to develop novel D-A copolymers have shown that 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole ( DTBT ) is an effective acceptor unit , and photovoltaic devices made from blends with fullerene derivatives show PCE up to 5.4% .

Let's think step by step.

1. The first mention of a material in the paragraph is thiophene.
2. The next material mentioned is dithiophene.
3. The author then mentions bridged dithiophene, specifically cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene (CPDT), dithienosilole (DTS), dithienogermole (DTG), and dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole (DTP).
4. The author also mentions benzothiadiazole (BT) and 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DTBT) as electron-withdrawing units.
5. The author mentions polymers based on DTS, DTG, and DTP, as well as copolymers containing DTP and PC 70 BM.

Therefore, the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph are:

1. Thiophene
2. Dithiophene
3. Bridged dithiophene (specifically CPDT, DTS, DTG, and DTP)
4. Benzothiadiazole (BT)
5. 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DTBT)
6. Polymers based on DTS, DTG, and DTP
7. Copolymers containing DTP and PC 70 BM.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material:

1. Thiophene
2. Dithiophene
3. Cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene (CPDT)
4. Dithienosilole (DTS)
5. Dithienogermole (DTG)
6. Dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole (DTP)
7. Benzothiadiazole (BT)
8. 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DTBT)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities presented in the same words as in the original paragraph:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Thiophene |
| Dithiophene |
| Cyclopenta[2,1-b;3,4-b′]dithiophene (CPDT) |
| Dithienosilole (DTS) |
| Dithienogermole (DTG) |
| Dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]pyrrole (DTP) |
| Benzothiadiazole (BT) |
| 4,7-dithien-2-yl-2,1,3-benzothiadiazole (DTBT) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12,13 The highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of this so - called donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type copolymers are mainly localized on the donor and acceptor units , respectively , thus the band gap can be well tuned by the choice of D and A. Such a D-A strategy is now widely used as one of the most promising approaches to design efficient polymers for application to the polymer photovoltaic. Let's think step by step.

Step 1: Identify the material properties mentioned in the paragraph.

* Band gap
* HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital)
* LUMO (lowest unoccupied molecular orbital)
* π-π stacking
* Steric hindrance
* Intermolecular steric hindrance
* Solubility
* Short-circuit current
* Fill factor
* Photovoltaic performance

Step 2: Identify the values (number + unit) of the material properties.

* Band gap: 5.5% (not a numerical value, but a relative value)
* HOMO and LUMO: not specified
* π-π stacking: not specified
* Steric hindrance: less steric hindrance (relative value)
* Intermolecular steric hindrance: lower intermolecular steric hindrance (relative value)
* Solubility: not specified
* Short-circuit current: 22.6 mA cm^-1 (numerical value)
* Fill factor: not specified
* Photovoltaic performance: 5.1% (not a numerical value, but a relative value)

Therefore, the values (number + unit) of material properties in the paragraph are:

* 22.6 mA cm^-1 (short-circuit current)

Note that the other material properties mentioned in the paragraph do not have specific numerical values or units mentioned.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here's the updated list of entities that refer to the Value of Material Property:

* 22.6 mA cm^-1 (short-circuit current)

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to the Value of Material Property:

* HOMO and LUMO (highest occupied molecular orbital and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital, respectively)
* π-π stacking
* Steric hindrance
* Intermolecular steric hindrance
* Solubility
* Fill factor
* Photovoltaic performance

These entities are related to the properties of the materials, but they do not directly refer to the value of a material property.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the table with the valid entities presented in the same words as in the original paragraph:

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 22.6 mA cm^-1 |

The table shows the short-circuit current (22.6 mA cm^-1) as the only valid entity that refers to the Value of Material Property.
